thread.title: Bayern Munich star humiliates Arsenal again in brutal Facebook post | Metro News
thread.title_full: Bayern Munich star humiliates Arsenal again in brutal Facebook post | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Bayern Munich star humiliates Arsenal again in brutal Facebook post | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 5:21 pm Manuel Neuer’s trolled Arsenal ahead of the second leg (Picture: Getty) 
Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer has trolled Arsenal by claiming he felt like he was on ‘holiday’ during the side’s 5-1 win at the Allianz Arena. 
The German had little to do for Carlo Ancelotti’s side as they put one foot into the quarter finals with a resounding win against the Gunners in the first leg. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
Arsene Wenger’s side were level at half-time in Germany but conceded four during the second half and Bayern are now the overwhelming favourites to reach the last eight. 
Bayern were back in action on Saturday when Robert Lewandowski’s late strike earned the league leaders a point away at Hertha Berlin. Arsenal were humiliated against Bayern (Picture: Getty) 
Neuer was called into action on a number of occasions and he’s made a dig at Arsenal’s lack of adventure at the Allianz Arena last week in his latest Facebook post. ‘After the holiday last Wednesday, yesterday was a hard day at work again,’ Neuer wrote on Facebook.
That’s Wenger’s pre-match team talk sorted, then.
